page.title: 04Thompsons Farm,Holbeach Hurn
page.content: Thompsons have farmed at Grove Farm for over 200 yrs.The present owner is Michael Thompson.Until about 1950 the main crop was potatoes. then they suffered badly as the land became poor and disease widespread.So sheep were introduced to put goodness back into the soil naturally.In 1965 a dairy herd of Friesans was introduced. This is based in Norfolk but the cows come to Grove Farm to be inseminated.There are now 200 dairy cows plus followers on,and about 5000 sheep.The sheep are a cross between a Wensleydale ewe and a Blue Leicester ram,known as "mules".They sell the wool-3kg.per sheep-and the lambs for meat.The sheep are dipped twice yearly and cannot be killed for 2 wks.The vegetables are grown on a 9 yr.rotation.This is it-peas,carrots,potatoes,beet,wheat,wh eat,onions then 2 yrs.of animals.
